body_html:
In fact, height or width read from tfrecords is a tensor, so we don't know its value until sess.run(height). the problem is that when the feature of image is used in fc layer, we can't initialize a weight of fc layer, because the shape of the feature is None.

so when reading images with different shape, and keep the shape of image in training, I am not sure how to it. if using tf.placeholder(), maybe I/O is the problem, of course I can use multi-thread and a queue
body_text:
In fact, height or width read from tfrecords is a tensor,  so we don't know its value until sess.run(height). the problem is that when the feature of image is used in fc layer,  we can't initialize a weight of fc layer, because the shape of the feature is None.
so when reading images with different shape, and keep the shape of image in training, I am not sure how to it. if using tf.placeholder(), maybe I/O is the problem, of course I can use multi-thread and a queue
body:
In fact, `height` or `width` read from tfrecords is a tensor,  so we don't know its value until `sess.run(height)`. the problem is that when the feature of image is used in fc layer,  we can't initialize a weight of fc layer, because the shape of the feature is `None`.

so when reading images with different shape, and keep the shape of image in training, I am not sure how to it. if using `tf.placeholder()`, maybe I/O is the problem, of course I can use multi-thread and a queue
